reviews.review_msg: I was worried that I wouldn't do well on the papers, but I followed his rubric closely and listened to the feedback from my TA and I did well. Meet with him if you are unsure about anything, he is easygoing and will help you out where needed. I found the material a bit dry but I'm not super interested in ethics. Overall, it was an ok course.

Dr. Snyder is a great professor and very passionate about this course and health ethics! This course was refreshing as it focussed on ethical theories that were never introduced throughout the Hsci degree program before. Dr. Snyder is kind and understanding. He provides advice and great outlines for papers and assignments. Exams and marking is fair

Asynchronous lectures so we didn't interact with Dr. Snyder much but he did pop into tutorials here and there and always emailed saying he was available for help. TA's are okay, not great. Felt like they were always looking for things to take marks off for and the feedback didn't really match the grade received. Overall not bad and an easy class.
